page.title: 14TRANSPORT IN GOXHILL.
page.content: There are only two roads to the south out of the village - one of these had a gated, manned level crossing which was recently replaced by an automatic crossing. A traffic census, carried out in the late morning of a Wednesday in July, confirmed that the majority of lorries entering the village by Thornton Road - the main access road - left within a short time. Cars left the village but returned after a short time. There are only two bus services; the Barton-Immingham, Grimsby service only skirts the village; the other service is run by Humberside Technical Services Department using school buses which transport children to secondary school in Barton. During the day this service runs to Barton from Goxhill, Barrow and New Holland but is very poorly used. The village's isolation makes people rely on their own cars.
